plan: First, I will test aggressive bidding by bidding close to my value to understand opponent tendencies and winning margins. In subsequent rounds, I will experiment with conservative bidding at 50-70% of my value to gauge frequency of wins vs. savings. I will also test random bids between 0 and 99 regardless of my value to gather data on opponents’ strategies. Additionally, I will track the bidding patterns of Betty and Charles to anticipate and counter their strategies. I will adjust my approach each round based on prior outcomes to maximize overall profit.

First, I will test a conservative strategy by bidding half my value. Second, I will test an aggressive strategy by bidding 75% of my value. Third, I will implement a randomized bid within 10% of my value to see if unpredictability pays off. Additionally, I will test a high-risk strategy by always adding a fixed amount (e.g., $10) to my value, capped at $99. I'll analyze the results from these rounds to identify patterns in opponents' behaviors and adjust my bids accordingly in subsequent rounds to maximize long-term profit.

I will test several bidding strategies to maximize long-term profit. Initially, I will place bids close to my value to establish a baseline. Next, I will experiment with more aggressive bids, sometimes exceeding my value to gather data on competitors' behavior. I will also test conservative bids to see if avoiding the risk of winning big at a high cost proves beneficial. I'll track outcomes to identify patterns in Andy’s and Betty's bids, such as consistent overbidding or underbidding, and adjust my strategy accordingly. All decisions will be made dynamically, based on observed trends and results.

1. I will start by bidding $80 if my value is above $80 to test if I still win with a higher profit margin. If my value is between $50 and $80, I will bid 70% of my value. For values below $50, I will bid the value itself to gather data on low-value bids. 2. Insight: Betty often bids mid-range while Charles bids lower - optimizing around $75-$80 could balance winning and profit. Random bids can reveal their ceiling limits.

Plan: 1. Test bidding 60% of my value. 2. Test aggressive bidding at 80% of value. 3. Implement alternating bids slightly above and below 50% of value each round for unpredictability. Insights: Observing that higher bids tend to win but at increased cost; middle-ground bids may balance between aiming to win and minimizing cost. High-risk aggressive bidding could lead to significant gains or losses, so refining based on opponents' patterns is crucial.

1. Plan: In the next round, I will place a bid slightly below my value (e.g., $10 less) to see if I can win at a lower cost or secure a profit while losing marginally. Insights: Andy and Betty might overbid close to their values. A lower bid might save cost in losing rounds. Consistent underbidding in some rounds could force opponents to reveal their maximum values.
